item.title: Life, Death, and Theatre with the Ekdahls
item.author: Pauline Ronnet,
item.description: Misha Handley steps onto the stage as Alexander Ekdahl and exclaims: “Ladies and Gentlemen, welcome to the longest play in the history of the world! …Will it be boring?” Laughter from the audience marks a departure from Bergman’s original cinematic version. Beresford’s play has a feel-good …

item.title: Van Dyck, Rubens, and Raphael from Charles I’s collection reunited
item.author: Pauline Ronnet,
item.description: Charles I left an astonishing artistic legacy as one of the most knowledgeable and distinguished art patrons in the history of Europe: “the greatest amateur of paintings among the princes of the world”, according to Rubens. He displayed little in the way of political artistry, however, and the …
